form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Hirono (for herself, Ms. Murkowski, and Mr. Schatz) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

form.official-title: To amend title 49, United States Code, to exempt certain flights from increased aviation security service fees.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Passenger Fee Restructuring Exemptions Act of 2015.

section.header: Exceptions to restructuring of passenger fee

subsection.text: Section 44940(c) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking Fees imposed and inserting Except as provided in paragraph (2), fees imposed;
by redesignating paragraph (2) as paragraph (3); and
by inserting after paragraph (1) the following:
Fees imposed under subsection (a)(1) may not exceed $2.50 per enplanement, and the total amount of such fees may not exceed $5.00 per one-way trip, for passengers—

subparagraph.text: boarding to an eligible place under subchapter II of chapter 417 for which essential air service compensation is paid under that subchapter; or
on flights, including flight segments, between 2 or more points in Hawaii or 2 or more points in Alaska.

subsection.text: The Secretary of Homeland Security shall implement the fee exceptions under the amendments made by subsection (a)—

paragraph.text: beginning on the date that is 30 days after the date of the enactment of this Act; and

through the publication of notice of the fee exceptions in the Federal Register, notwithstanding section 9701 of title 31, United States Code, and the procedural requirements of section 553 of title 5, United States Code.
